Add README docs for flamegraph.getName

I used this recently with some JSON where I couldn't easily add a `name` key.
Update README with all palettes in colorScheme.js

Add flamegraph.getName() to index.d.ts

This is causing some lint errors on a project I'm trying to use this function on.
task: bumping version

Don't animate left & top properties

I accidentally inlined these in a previous commit, thinking if they were in the same d3 chain of methods, it would be a no-op.

But the .transition().duration(200) makes these properties animate, leading to a funny dance where the tooltip chases the pointer, 200ms behind.

Moving these property setting before the transition() fixes the problem.
task: bump version
Merge branch 'mhansen-tip'

Update examples and README to use tooltip.text()

This avoids the risky .html() method, which can interpret data as HTML accidentally.

Add tooltip.text(), deprecate tooltip.html()

This avoids accidentally interpreting text as HTML.

I'm leaving the previous method behind, because some callers might rely on it.

Add some more tests, and clean up DOM

Just some more scaffolding before I'm about to make a change.

Add test for tooltips

This isn't the desired behaviour, I'm just adding a test to make sure I don't break anything.

Remove references to d3-tip

The repository https://github.com/caged/d3-tip is now a public archive, devlopment has ceased, and it isn't being updated to the new versions of d3.  See https://github.com/caged/d3-tip/issues/239#issuecomment-443053926

And most importantly, its only API for setting content is .html(), which puts a burden of having to html-escape content on any user.
fix: details handler vul

Use textContent, not innerHTML, in search

The default was safe, because the inputs were only numbers.

But we want to encourage users to use the safe .textContent over
.innerHTML, so update the code and README example.

HTML-escape profile frames in details element

This ensures stack frames like `<root>` are rendered correctly.

And prevents potential script injection when handling untrusted profiles.

Add tests for details, search, HTML-escaping

These aren't desired end states, they're just reflecting the current behaviour.

We'll change these tests soon, they're just to make sure we don't break
anything inadvertently when we make the subsequent changes.

Quote some code blocks in the README

So they display as code, rather than plain-text, all run-together on one line.

Update README example for latest d3 Promise API

Fixes #197
task: bump version
task: update package-lock
docs: update examples with d3 v7
docs: update readme with new examples
task: upgrade d3 dependencies
fix: lint
task: upgrade dependencies

Merge pull request #194 from spiermar/task_upgrade_deps

task: upgrade dev deps
test: specify jsdom test environment
fix: regex instead of string
task: upgrade deps
fix: trying with quotes
fix: trying simplistic version
fix: trying without quotes
fix: check tag push for build
task: bump version
fix: workflows dir
task: rename action
feat: publish npm action. fixes #165.
fix: clear search on merge. fixes #132.
fix: only recalculate total value on new data. fixes #143.
fix: update svg size with update. fixes #146.
feat: onHover option. implements #167.
fix: destroy tooltip on chart destroy. fixes #189.
fix: issue with webpack library name. fixes #180.

Merge pull request #188 from nickgirardo/typescript-sort-fn

feat: allow passing comparators to typescript flamegraph.sort

Bumps [immer](https://github.com/immerjs/immer) and [react-dev-utils](https://github.com/facebook/create-react-app/tree/HEAD/packages/react-dev-utils). These dependencies needed to be updated together.

Updates `immer` from 8.0.1 to 9.0.15
- [Release notes](https://github.com/immerjs/immer/releases)
- [Commits](https://github.com/immerjs/immer/compare/v8.0.1...v9.0.15)

Updates `react-dev-utils` from 11.0.4 to 12.0.1
- [Release notes](https://github.com/facebook/create-react-app/releases)
- [Changelog](https://github.com/facebook/create-react-app/blob/main/CHANGELOG-1.x.md)
- [Commits](https://github.com/facebook/create-react-app/commits/react-dev-utils@12.0.1/packages/react-dev-utils)

---
updated-dependencies:

  dependency-type: indirect

  dependency-type: direct:development
...

Add README docs for flamegraph.getName

I used this recently with some JSON where I couldn't easily add a `name` key.
Update README with all palettes in colorScheme.js

Add flamegraph.getName() to index.d.ts

This is causing some lint errors on a project I'm trying to use this function on.
task: bumping version

Don't animate left & top properties

I accidentally inlined these in a previous commit, thinking if they were in the same d3 chain of methods, it would be a no-op.

But the .transition().duration(200) makes these properties animate, leading to a funny dance where the tooltip chases the pointer, 200ms behind.

Moving these property setting before the transition() fixes the problem.
task: bump version
Merge branch 'mhansen-tip'

Update examples and README to use tooltip.text()

This avoids the risky .html() method, which can interpret data as HTML accidentally.

Add tooltip.text(), deprecate tooltip.html()

This avoids accidentally interpreting text as HTML.

I'm leaving the previous method behind, because some callers might rely on it.

Add some more tests, and clean up DOM

Just some more scaffolding before I'm about to make a change.

Add test for tooltips

This isn't the desired behaviour, I'm just adding a test to make sure I don't break anything.

Remove references to d3-tip

The repository https://github.com/caged/d3-tip is now a public archive, devlopment has ceased, and it isn't being updated to the new versions of d3.  See https://github.com/caged/d3-tip/issues/239#issuecomment-443053926

And most importantly, its only API for setting content is .html(), which puts a burden of having to html-escape content on any user.
fix: details handler vul

Use textContent, not innerHTML, in search

The default was safe, because the inputs were only numbers.

But we want to encourage users to use the safe .textContent over
.innerHTML, so update the code and README example.

HTML-escape profile frames in details element

This ensures stack frames like `<root>` are rendered correctly.

And prevents potential script injection when handling untrusted profiles.

Add tests for details, search, HTML-escaping

These aren't desired end states, they're just reflecting the current behaviour.

We'll change these tests soon, they're just to make sure we don't break
anything inadvertently when we make the subsequent changes.

Quote some code blocks in the README

So they display as code, rather than plain-text, all run-together on one line.

Update README example for latest d3 Promise API

Fixes #197
task: bump version
task: update package-lock
docs: update examples with d3 v7
docs: update readme with new examples
task: upgrade d3 dependencies
fix: lint
task: upgrade dependencies

Merge branch 'mhansen-tip'

I'm leaving the previous method behind, because some callers might rely on it.

Just some more scaffolding before I'm about to make a change.

This isn't the desired behaviour, I'm just adding a test to make sure I don't break anything.

Remove references to d3-tip

The repository https://github.com/caged/d3-tip is now a public archive, devlopment has ceased, and it isn't being updated to the new versions of d3.  See https://github.com/caged/d3-tip/issues/239#issuecomment-443053926

And most importantly, its only API for setting content is .html(), which puts a burden of having to html-escape content on any user.

Use textContent, not innerHTML, in search

The default was safe, because the inputs were only numbers.

But we want to encourage users to use the safe .textContent over
.innerHTML, so update the code and README example.

HTML-escape profile frames in details element

This ensures stack frames like `<root>` are rendered correctly.

And prevents potential script injection when handling untrusted profiles.

Add tests for details, search, HTML-escaping

These aren't desired end states, they're just reflecting the current behaviour.

We'll change these tests soon, they're just to make sure we don't break
anything inadvertently when we make the subsequent changes.

Quote some code blocks in the README

So they display as code, rather than plain-text, all run-together on one line.

And prevents potential script injection when handling untrusted profiles.

Add tests for details, search, HTML-escaping

These aren't desired end states, they're just reflecting the current behaviour.

We'll change these tests soon, they're just to make sure we don't break
anything inadvertently when we make the subsequent changes.

Quote some code blocks in the README

So they display as code, rather than plain-text, all run-together on one line.

Update README example for latest d3 Promise API

Fixes #197

Add README docs for flamegraph.getName

I used this recently with some JSON where I couldn't easily add a `name` key.
Update README with all palettes in colorScheme.js

Add flamegraph.getName() to index.d.ts

This is causing some lint errors on a project I'm trying to use this function on.
task: bumping version

Don't animate left & top properties

I accidentally inlined these in a previous commit, thinking if they were in the same d3 chain of methods, it would be a no-op.

But the .transition().duration(200) makes these properties animate, leading to a funny dance where the tooltip chases the pointer, 200ms behind.

Moving these property setting before the transition() fixes the problem.
task: bump version
Merge branch 'mhansen-tip'

Update examples and README to use tooltip.text()

This avoids the risky .html() method, which can interpret data as HTML accidentally.

Add tooltip.text(), deprecate tooltip.html()

This avoids accidentally interpreting text as HTML.

I'm leaving the previous method behind, because some callers might rely on it.

Add some more tests, and clean up DOM

Just some more scaffolding before I'm about to make a change.

Add test for tooltips

This isn't the desired behaviour, I'm just adding a test to make sure I don't break anything.

Remove references to d3-tip

The repository https://github.com/caged/d3-tip is now a public archive, devlopment has ceased, and it isn't being updated to the new versions of d3.  See https://github.com/caged/d3-tip/issues/239#issuecomment-443053926

And most importantly, its only API for setting content is .html(), which puts a burden of having to html-escape content on any user.
fix: details handler vul

Use textContent, not innerHTML, in search

The default was safe, because the inputs were only numbers.

But we want to encourage users to use the safe .textContent over
.innerHTML, so update the code and README example.

HTML-escape profile frames in details element

This ensures stack frames like `<root>` are rendered correctly.

And prevents potential script injection when handling untrusted profiles.

Add tests for details, search, HTML-escaping

These aren't desired end states, they're just reflecting the current behaviour.

We'll change these tests soon, they're just to make sure we don't break
anything inadvertently when we make the subsequent changes.

Quote some code blocks in the README

So they display as code, rather than plain-text, all run-together on one line.

Update README example for latest d3 Promise API

Fixes #197
